selectCategory.name: Guitar
selectCategory.description: A stringed musical instrument that typically has six strings and is played by strumming or plucking the strings with the fingers or a pick.

string.name: Guitar
string.description: A stringed musical instrument that typically has six strings and is played by strumming or plucking the strings with the fingers or a pick.

string.name: Electric Guitar
string.description: Similar to an acoustic guitar but with electric pickups that convert string vibrations into electrical signals, which can be amplified.

string.name: Violin
string.description: A string instrument that is played with a bow, producing sound by vibrating strings stretched over a resonating body.

string.name: Cello
string.description: A large, bowed string instrument with four strings tuned in perfect fifths, known for its deep, rich sound in the bass and tenor registers.

keyboard.name: Piano
keyboard.description: A large musical instrument with a row of black and white keys that are pressed to play notes, producing sound by striking strings with hammers.

keyboard.name: Keyboard
keyboard.description: A musical instrument consisting of a row of keys that are pressed, triggering electronic sounds.

keyboard.name: Organ
keyboard.description: A keyboard instrument that produces sound by pipes or reeds fed with air from a bellows or electronic means.

keyboard.name: Synthesizer
keyboard.description: An electronic musical instrument that generates audio signals that may be converted to sound through a loudspeaker or headphones.

speakers.name: Monitor Speaker
speakers.description: Speakers designed for audio production applications such as recording studios, filmmaking, television studios, and radio studios.

speakers.name: PA Speaker
speakers.description: Speakers used to address a public gathering or crowd, commonly used in concerts, public events, and rallies.

amplifiers.name: Guitar Amplifier
amplifiers.description: An amplifier specifically designed to amplify the sound of an electric guitar.

amplifiers.name: Bass Amplifier
amplifiers.description: An amplifier specifically designed to amplify the sound of a bass guitar.

mics.name: Dynamic Microphone
mics.description: A type of microphone that uses electromagnetic induction to generate an electrical signal.

mics.name: Condenser Microphone
mics.description: A type of microphone that uses a capacitor to convert acoustical energy into electrical energy.

mics.name: Wireless Microphone
mics.description: A microphone without a physical cable connecting it directly to the sound recording or amplifying equipment with which it is associated.

effectPedals.name: Distortion Pedal
effectPedals.description: A pedal that alters the sound of an electric guitar or other amplified instrument by increasing its gain and clipping the signal, producing a 'distorted' sound.

effectPedals.name: Reverb Pedal
effectPedals.description: A pedal that simulates the reverberation or 'reverb' of a sound in a physical space, adding depth and ambiance to the audio signal.
